The hidden city of Felonia was having another peaceful day until...

"Flash! Flash!" shouted the feline chief of the city's security team, as he rushed to the city's guardian. Flash looked 17 years old, and wore a black leather jacker and blue jeans over his brown-furred body. A Japanese-style sword was prodded against him in its scabbard. He had been meditating when the chief had called him.

Flash twitched his whiskers as he said, "What is it, chief?"

The chief then explained, "Flash, we just picked up signs of an intruder in the west area of the city,"

"Very well, chief; I will inspect this," said Flash, picking up his sword. The chief didn't ask if he needed back-up...Flash was probably the most powerful warrior in all of Felonia.

Later, Flash was walking through the west area, when he came across an unconcious figure laying on the ground. He cautiously approached it, and found the figure was a girl...

"Hmm...come with me. BTW, my name is Flash, champion of Felonia," said Flash, as Rouge got up.

As Rouge followed Flash, she happened to notice the girls and women of Felonia were all overweight.

"How come the women here are so...big?" asked Rouge.

Without turning around, Flash simply answered, "That is the standard image of beauty for women here," It was then Rouge's stomach growled, making her blush. Flash turned around and said, "Appears you haven't eaten in a while. I'll get you something to eat," He went into a fast-food joint nearby and bought Rouge a little snack.

"Huh. That's odd. I guess it doesn't take a whole night's rest after all. I wonder what I look like."

Her chest was large and round, like two basketballs. Her stomache was large like a small beach ball and extended slightly past her chest and hang down from her waist by one inch. Rouge sighed as she looked at herself. Why did she choke up like that? Of course, she never was interrogated before. Was she just really nervous?

Didn't matter. She was now forever 150 pounds. And she would have to watch herself carefully until the curse was broken. 1122.content:
Rouge opened her eyes. She couldn't see very well...everything was blurry. She saw something white and brown, but couldn't make out what it was. Then her vision started to focus...she could see...a face, yes, a face, with big blue eyes and a black nose. Soon she knew exactly what she was looking at: A brown furred cat. Without thinking, Rouge reacted. She turned her body into a kick that sent Flash through the air, surprised, and into a tree. She then pulled out her pistol, a slim .45 caliber with the logo of the GUN printed on the grip. Flash quickly pulled out his sword. She fired, but Flash swung and deflected the bullet, sending it careening into a tree. The sound of the ricochet echoed into forest with a deafening bang.

Rouge blinked. What had happened? And why wasn't he dead? She fired again, and Flash deflected it again. Flash started moving forward. Now Rouge was scared. She kept pulling the trigger, trying so desperately to kill this brown furred cat, all the while Flash moving closer and closer to Rouge. She eventually ran out of ammunition. She turned to run, but it was too late. Flash dove in and tackled her, wrestling her to the ground and pinning her arms down.

"Ugh! Get off of me!" Rouge said, struggling to get out of Flash's iron grip.
"No!" Flash shouted. "Who are you and what is your business?"
"Let me go and I'll tell you!"
"I can't take the risk of you flying away with those batty wings of yours. Tell me your name, at least!"
"I'm Rouge, acclaimed treasure hunter and agent of the Guardian Units of Nations, better known as the GUN!" Flash's eyes widened.
"The GUN?" Flash quickly backed up and off of Rouge.
"I know of the GUN, they founded our local Security Team and funded our headquarters!" He said.
"Really? Where am I?"
"You mean you don't know?"
"I know I wasn't here, THAT'S for sure."
"You're on the outskirts of Felonia, the hidden city. You tripped one of our alarms, and I was sent to find out what tripped it, and this is where I found you." Rouge stared blankly.
"Felonia?"
"Yes. Why can't you remember where you were previously?" Flash asked.
"I think I got bonked on the head pretty hard, 'cause when I look back at where I was it's all...blurry...I can't even remember who knocked me out!"
"Hmmm..." Flash pondered the situation. After thinking about it for a while, he said, "Okay, this is what we'll do: I'll take you to the Security Team headquarters. I'm sure the Chief will be able to find out where you were, and send you home straight away!"
"Who's the Chief?" Flash opened his mouth to give an answer, when a drop of rain hit his head. A clap of thunder made both Rouge and Flash jump with fright, and soon, it was raining cats and dogs (no pun intended). Flash grabbed Rouge by the hand.
"Come on! Let's get out of this downpour!" Rouge ran after Flash, struggling to keep up as he led her through the woods to Felonia.

Flash ran with Rouge behind him, trying desperately to get out of the rain. Eventually, they got to the east wall of the city.
"Rouge, get into my arms!"
"Um...okay..." Flash cradled Rouge's head and lifted her legs up into his arms. Rouge was about to ask Flash what he was doing, when she realized she hadn't even asked what his name was. Before she had time to say anything, however, Flash crouched down and leaped high into the air, sending him and a screaming Rouge sailing over the 30-foot-high east wall and into the hidden city of Felonia. Flash landed, and let Rouge onto her feet. She was about to say thank you when Flash once again grabbed her hand and took off. By the time they reached Security Team headquarters, they were both soaking wet. Flash quickly opened the metal door and let Rouge inside. The two of them fell to they're knees, panting with exhaustion.

Before either of them could react, Felonia City Police and Security Team personnel surrounded them, pointing various ballistic weapons at Rouge. Rouge instinctively hid behind Flash, hoping he would protect her. Flash looked dead straight, looking for one person in particular. She soon arrived. Rouge watched as the police and Security Team members parted and stood at attention. The slow rhythm of stiletto heels striking the wooden floors echoed in the large hallway as someone walked between the sea of gunmen. Eventually a female cat resembling that of Flash stood before them. She wore somewhat loose black jeans with a holster that hid a powerful handgun, held up by a tight leather belt. She also wore a back shirt that was a bit too small, leaving her brown and tan belly exposed. The shirt had the words "Security Team" on the front in white print, with an unbuttoned dark blue jacket over it all. A ruby necklace dangled around her neck, a golden earring stood out proudly on her right ear, and a pair of black stiletto heeled shoes adorned her feet. On her head she wore a dark blue hat that sat on a head of dark brown hair that went down to her knees. With a cigarette between her teeth and a glare in her soft green eyes, Rouge reasoned that this chick was NOT someone she wanted to mess with. The cat in question slowly approached Flash, stopping but three feet away. She lifted her hand, and everyone behind her lowered they're weapons.

"So, is this our intruder?" The feminine feline asked.
11221.title: Stuck

112211.content:
"So, is this our intruder?" The feminine feline asked.
"Why, yes it is." Flash answered. "She is a GUN agent who goes by the name of Rouge. When I found Rouge, she was unconscious. And when she awoke, she attacked me, but I quickly subdued her. She claims to have received a rather large hit to the head, and that she cannot remember where she was before she "mysteriously" arrived here."
"Well in that case," she turned and looked at Rouge, "Welcome to the hidden city of Felonia. I am Trinity, Chief of the Security Team. I see you have already met our freelance operative and warrior champion Flash."
"Wait, YOU'RE the Chief?" Rouge asked.
"That I am. What's it to you?"
"Nothing, I just..."
"Nothing indeed," Trinity interrupted, "Now, we need to find you a way home. If you're a GUN agent, then I'm sure the Commander will want to know where you are." Rouge shivered on the inside. The Commander would NOT be happy about her mysterious disappearing act. She was thinking ahead to what she would say to the Commander (or rather, her excuse) when Flash tapped her on the shoulder, making her jump three feet in the air.

"Come on," Flash said, "Everyone's going this way." Rouge was stunned. She hadn't even noticed everyone's leaving because she was so frightened of the Commander. Rouge shook her head and followed Flash down the hallway of the Security Team headquarters. Rouge looked side to side. They passed at least fifteen doors on either side when the reached a metal vault-style door at the end of the hall. Rouge watched as Trinity entered a thirty-digit pass code to open the door, and as the giant door swung inward. The Security Team members and Felonia City Police quickly dispersed, leaving Rouge, Flash, and Trinity standing in front of the massive door. Flash made a gesture for Rouge to go in before him, and she stepped into a technological wonderland. Every wall it seemed was covered in computer and TV screens, a giant screen taking its place in the center of the room. Stairs went down either wall, and there was a platform leading to an observation deck that gave you a birds-eye view of the entire room. Rouge followed Trinity onto the platform and from there to the observation deck. Rouge almost had a heart attack when Flash closed the giant door behind them, making a rather large metallic clang.

"This," Trinity said, gesturing to the entire room, "Is the Command Center; a fully operational security system watching every corner of every street of every province of Felonia. Our 24/7 staff operates at maximum efficiency to keep our fair city safe." Rouge looked around. Almost fifty men in Security Team uniform were either taking their place monitoring a specific area, repairing equipment and other various tasks. "Now, let's call the Commander." Trinity said. She tapped her foot and a terminal rose out of a hatch concealed in the floor in front of her. The giant screen in the center of the room turned on, and a log in appeared. Trinity cracked her knuckles. She then started typing. Rouge watched Trinity's fingers dart around the keyboard faster than anything she had ever seen. When she finished, Trinity had entered a one hundred-digit pass code. The computer gave her access, and she pulled up a communication program. She rifled through the various files of contacts until she found the Commander's private channel. "Hit it!" Trinity yelled."
"Roger!" said a Security Team staff member.
"Dish up in five...four...three...two..one...now." said another.
"Satellite is up, Chief!" said the first.
"Thanks, guys." Trinity said. "Do we have a connection?"
"Unconfirmed, Chief."
"Try it anyway, the storm must be causing this." Trinity replied. The channel broadcast systems activated, and there was a brief period of silence. Suddenly, the screen went to white noise.
"Turn it off, TURN IT OFF!!!" Rouge yelled.
"Turn it off!" Trinity ordered. After a few seconds, the connection was severed. Rouge fell to her knees with pain, tear is her eyes. The frequency of the white noise was high enough to hurt her sensitive ears, and at such a high volume, it was almost deafening. Flash quickly helped her to her feet.
"Are you alright, Rouge?" he asked compassionately.
"Ugh...yeah, I'm fine...damn that hurt!" Rouge sniffled, covering her ears.
"Damn storm. We can't get a signal through! That's just terrific!" Trinity vented.
"What are you guys so pissed about? The storm will blow away after a day or two." Rouge said.
"Heh, you're wrong about that." Flash said. "When it rains on this island, it rains for at least a week."
"Wait...we're on an island?" Rouge asked.
"Yeah, Felacci Island." Flash answered.
"And you didn't care to mention this before?"
"Sorry, guess I forgot to mention that."
"Now, what's this about at least a week of rain?" Rouge asked.
"It doesn't rain very often on Felacci, but when it does, it lingers over Felonia for at least a week." Flash replied.
"Sorry to be the bearer of bad news, honey, but it looks like you're stuck on this island until the storm clears, and that won't be for quite a while." Trinity said.

We had a hard time getting you back together, but after a few hours of work and a few more in this stasis tank, you're as good as new." he says. "Cha-chao!" 1321211221.content:
"...I'm not going to risk you getting into more trouble. You'll just have to stay like that until someone comes to get you." says Flash. "Now, do you live with anyone?" he asks.

Cream giggles. "I understand, and yes! I live with my mom, Vanilla, although I'm not sure how I'm going to explain this to her..."

Flash nods. "Ok, Vanilla, then. We have a fairly extensive database of all kinds of furs and people and such, so we should have her on her way in no time."

"Ooooh...is it like some kind of high-tech supercomputer?" Cream asks.

Flash chuckles. "Actually, it's the internet, although as far as I know, the site could be hosted on a high-tech supercomputer." he says, which causes Cream to giggle. "Hehe. You're funny when you want to be." she says, as she smiles at him.

"Yeah, yeah...anyway, you wait here, and I'll have your mom over here in no time." Flash says, as he places the curled up bunny on a chair and walks off to get Vanilla.

---

"Are you sure I need to wear this blindfold?" Vanilla says, as she starts to put one on as Flash drives her to Felonia.

Flash chuckles, and shakes his head a bit. "No, no. I'm sure you wouldn't pose a threat to us, so you really don't have to, but..."

Vanilla raises an eyebrow, which is mostly obscured by the blindfold. "But...?"

"It's a hidden city for a reason, ma'am. The only people who are allowed to know where exactly it is are citizens, so if you know where it is, you'd have to become or citizen. If you didn't, I'd be forced to keep you and your daughter in a holding cell for a while until it's determined that you'd never tell anyone else about where the city is...we have rather nice holding cells, though." Flash explains, as he narrowly avoids crashing into a car that stopped in front of him while he was giving his explanation. "...and it's not safe to talk and drive." he says, chuckling a little.

Vanilla blinks, a little shook up from narrowly being in a crash. She soon recovers, and considers her options...

-----

"Oh my, Flash said you'd be in an odd shape, but I wasn't quite expecting this!" Vanilla exclaims, as she looks her rolled-up daughter over.

Cream giggles. "Don't worry, mom, it actually feels pretty nice!"

Vanilla smiles. "Well, since you seem to be enjoying your stay here, I don't see why we can't spend our days here."

"Oooh, yay! I was hoping you'd let let me stay here. I've been having so much fun!" she exclaims.

A short time later, Flash returns after talking to some scientists in the lab. "Ok, I have good news, you two. There is a way to speed up the registration process, but it involves a commitment from you two."

Vanilla blinks. "What kind of commitment?"

"Well, our scientists think your daughter would make a very willing test subject, and are also considering you for experimentation. If you both agree to become test subjects, we'll give you housing and everything you could ever need. You can decline, of course, but you'll have to remain in a holding cell until a place is found for you." Flash explains.

Cream grins. "Let's do it, mom!"

Vanilla blinks. "Uhm...let me think about it first, dear..."

"We accept. Cream seems rather enthusiastic about it and I don't think I'd mind, either." says Vanilla.

Flash nods. "Good, good. We already have a place set up for you, too." He says. "Come with me, please." Flash says, as he heads out of the lab. Vanilla does the same after she pockets Cream for lack of a better way to carry her.

-----

"Ok, here's the place." Flash says, having led Vanilla to a rectangular building within the lab. "The back windows will give you a great view of the city, and the housing unit is as large as you would expect a house to be. Oh, and you'll also have a roommate."

Vanilla gently smiles. "Thank you so much, and we won't mind having a roommate." she says, as she and Cream enter the house.

-----

"Wow, you're our roommate, Amy!?" exclaims Cream, surprised to see a familiar face.

Amy giggles. "It was either this or rotting in a cell for who knows how long. I see they're already experimenting on you, Cream." she says, giggling a little.

"Ah, no, this is just a mistake they made in restoring me, though they say I should be alright once I'm inflated again." Cream explains.

Amy nods. "I see, well, you two made a good choice. I've been at this for a week and it's been going pretty well...but where should I begin?"
132121122111.title: New Home.

13212112212.content:
Vanilla keeps the blindfold on. "The offer is nice and all, but I'm fine with where I live right now. I really don't want to cause any trouble, I just want my daughter back safe and reletively sound."

Flash nods, as he continues to drive Vanilla to Felonia.

------------

"Do we have to leave? I was just starting to enjoy it here." Cream says, as Vanilla picks her rolled up daughter from off the chair.

Vanilla nods. "Yes dear, we do. While I'm not mad at you for it, you have been somewhat of a danger to yourself while you're here. I hope you understand, Cream." Vanilla says, as she puts Cream under her left arm.

Cream smiles. "Of course, of course." she says, as Vanilla turns to Flash.

"I hope there isn't any fees or anything I have to pay." Vanilla asks. Flash shakes his head. "Well, normally there's a fine for misusing the compressed helium tanks, but it's not really much and it's in our own currency, so you should be good to go." he explains.

Vanilla smiles. "Very well then. Let's get going, Cream." Vanilla says, as she walks off with Cream and tow.

"So...when are you going to reinflate me?" Cream asks, as Vanilla cradles her in her right arm. Vanilla smiles. "I'm not sure...I might keep you like this for a while." Vanilla jokes, as she gently strokes the bundled bunny.

Cream happily sighs as Vanilla does this. "Well...take your time, mom. I'm really happy like this." she says, as she lets out a little squeal of delight.

Epiloge
------------

While Cream was the only one of of her and her mother that knew about the hidden city, she was sure never to tell anyone about it's location. However, she was more than happy to share her newfound love for expanding and deflating herself with her closest friends, moreso with Tails and Amy...

"See Amy? I told you this would be great!" Cream exclaims, as the hedgehog girl slowly floats up to meet her while Tails rides on Cream's shoulders.

Amy huffs as she rotates in mid air. "It's great for you because you're used to it. And I feel really bloated too, and ano-" *Pffffffft!* goes Amy, which causes Cream and Tails to laugh.

"Well, gee, no wonder you feel bloated. Are you sure you filled up with helium, or did you just gorge yourself with food until you got so gassy you could float?" Cream says, stifling a giggle.

Tails tries to stifle his own laugher. "Maybe she just inflated herself too quickly."

Amy grumbles as her face turns red, partly from anger and partly from embarrassment. "Urk. I said I wa- *pfft!* -sn't used to it! You don't need t- *frrt!* -o rub it in!"

Cream giggles a bit. "We don't want to rub it in, Amy. We're afraid it might come out in one big blast if we do that!" she squeals. Amy just sighs, and continues to idly rotate while she passes gas...

Eventually, though, Amy does get used to it, and from there, the girls gradually increase their limits as the days go on, eventually rivaling the size of large cities, and so on.

One day, however, girls just suddenly vanished without a trace. What could have happened to them? Did Cream and Amy end up bursting themselves trying to outsize each other?

Perhaps they just got so light that they floated right out into space, with nothing to do but to grow for the rest of their lives. They could have been experimenting with hyrdogen, with a end result that was signicantly more explosive than the end results Amy just had. Laughs

Or maybe they were placed in some old, forgotten dresser while they were deflated. Maybe it's locked and Tails forgot the combination. Or may-

Blinks, as the rear end of a puffy and bloated hedgehog ends up right next to him.

...oh cra- *Pffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffft!* goes Amy, as Nelson the narrartor is subjected to a point-blank blast.
